title.narrative: 4.3 EDUCATION GOVERNANCE

description.narrative: Education ministries have reliable data management, credible accountability structures and quality assurance mechanisms in place and domestic financing for education is increased by 5 per cent., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, the GER for primary school has increased by 9 per cent, ensuring safe, equitable and quality education, with improved learning outcomes for learners at pre-primary, primary and secondary levels, with a focus on the most disadvantaged and vulnerable children, especially girls, populations and geographic areas.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Education ministries have reliable data management, credible accountability structures and quality assurance mechanisms in placeand domestic financing for education is increased by 5 per cent.

description.narrative: The Annual Education Statistics Yearbook 2018-19 by the Federal MoECHE, Puntland MoE/HE and Somaliland MoES are available for dissemination and use. Puntland conducted its 5th JRES (Joint Review for the Education Sector) workshop, bringing together key education partners and reviewed the overall sector performance over the last two years. Total 2,074 CEC members (22% female) were trained using the harmonised training manual, with a special focus on a participatory approach, ownership and sustainability of education to improve enrolment, attendance and awareness on the importance of education. A Federal Inter-Ministerial Task Force was established to implement the Safe Schools Declaration protocols | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:29/12/2020
